greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of unimodal negated permutations of the multiset of prime indices of n.
comment: A prime index of n is a number m such that prime(m) divides n. The multiset of prime indices of n is row n of A112798.
A sequence of integers is unimodal if it is the concatenation of a weakly increasing and a weakly decreasing sequence.
Also permutations of the multiset of prime indices of n avoiding the patterns (1,2,1), (1,3,2), and (2,3,1).
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Unimodal Sequence
xref: A more interesting version is A332741.
The complement is counted by A333146.
Compositions whose negation is unimodal are A332578.
Partitions with unimodal negated run-lengths are A332638.
Numbers with non-unimodal negated unsorted prime signature are A332642.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Mar 09 2020
